text: Thomas Mackenzie (1793 – 9 June 1856) was a British Conservative Party politician. Mackenzie was elected Conservative MP for at a by-election in 1837—caused by the resignation of James Alexander Stewart-Mackenzie—and held the seat until 1847 when he did not seek re-election. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for Highland constituencies Category:Scottish Tory MPs (pre-1912) Category:UK MPs 1835–1837 Category:UK MPs 1837–1841 Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:1793 births Category:1856 deaths
title: Thomas Mackenzie (Scottish politician)
